CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violations of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and resides in the village of GPE , the GPE region , GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant was dismissed from the military forces .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) ordered ORG to pay the applicant CARDINAL NORP hryvnyas ( ORG ) for his uniform expenses for the period up to DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement proceedings were discontinued because of the debtor ’s lack of funds and because , according to LAW , the property of ORG could not be used to enforce a court decision .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , on DATE the decision was enforced in part by the debtor . At CARDINAL DATE the decision had not been enforced in full .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against his former employer , the Akimovskiy ORG , claiming an allowance due to him for the period of DATE . The applicant stated that though he was officially dismissed on DATE , he had actually left the forces on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found for the applicant and awarded him UAH CARDINAL for the unpaid allowance to be paid by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed that decision and remitted the case for a fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found against the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decisions of DATE and DATE upon a protest , lodged by the President of ORG ( at the applicant ’s request ) , and remitted the case for a fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . The applicant lodged an additional claim asking to change the date of his dismissal and requesting the payment of an insurance premium , compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage , and the enforcement of the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , considering the case in the applicant ’s presence , changed the date of his dismissal and ordered ORG to pay him UAH CARDINAL.CARDINAL for the unpaid allowance and other payments .
CARDINAL . The applicant did not appeal against the decision .
CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE , the applicant informed the ORG that the decision of DATE had been enforced in full , without specifying the date of enforcement .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG and ORG with claims similar to those in the second set of proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court returned the applicant ’s claim , stating that he had failed to pay the court fee and to enclose any evidence in support of his claim as required by the legislation .
CARDINAL . The applicant neither appealed against that decision nor submitted his claim anew .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG contesting the lawfulness of his dismissal from the military service and seeking compensation for damage . The applicant also clamed that the defendant had been unlawfully ignoring the court decisions in his favour .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court returned the applicant ’s claim for res judicata reasons , stating , in particular , that such a claim had already been considered by the courts .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed that decision and remitted the case for a fresh consideration , finding that the applicant ’s claim had not been considered by the courts before .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG returned the applicant ’s claim for failure to indicate all the requisites of the claim , and to enclose any evidence in its support , as required by the legislation .

CARDINAL . The applicant states that this decision was sent to him too late to enable him to appeal against it within the fixed time - limit . The applicant did not submit any request for an extension of the time - limit for appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected an appeal by the applicant against the decision of DATE under the extraordinary review procedure .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law regarding enforcement of court decisions is summarised in the judgment of PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE )
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :
“ The independence and immunity of judges are guaranteed by LAW and the laws of GPE .
Influencing judges in any manner is prohibited ... ”
“ In the administration of justice , judges are independent and subject only to the law ... ”

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Code provided that garrison military courts , as first - instance courts , had jurisdiction over civil cases where military servicemen challenged the lawfulness of acts or decisions taken by military officials or military bodies as well as over other civil cases where military servicemen ’s rights and freedoms were claimed to be violated , except for cases falling within the jurisdiction of the regional military courts . The regional military courts , as first - instance courts , had jurisdiction over civil cases where the lawfulness of acts or decisions taken by military officials or military bodies having the level of a military association or higher , were challenged .

CARDINAL . In accordance with Sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Code , appeals against decisions of military garrison courts were to be submitted to the military regional courts . Appeals against decisions of the military regional courts were to be submitted to ORG .

CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL , CARDINAL - CARDINAL , CARDINAL of the Act provided that the military courts were incorporated into the system of the general courts of GPE . They exercised judicial power in ORG and other military formations allowed by NORP legislation . The judges of the military courts were elected by the Verkhovna Rada of GPE for DATE . The candidates , on passing a competitive examination the first time , were elected for DATE . Only an acting officer in the army could become a judge of the military court .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Act envisaged that the financing , logistics , maintenance and archiving of the military courts and ORG of ORG were performed by entities of ORG at the expense of ORG and ORG , using part of ORG allocated specifically for those purposes .

CARDINAL . According to LAW of the LAW the servicemen of the military courts were considered to be in military service and constituted a part of the staff of ORG . The judges of the military courts were awarded military ranks by the President of GPE upon the joint submission of ORG and the Chairman of ORG ( as regards the judges of the military garrison courts , military regional courts , and naval courts ) or upon the sole submission of the Chairman of ORG ( as regards the judges of the military chamber of ORG ) .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Act provided that a military chamber was incorporated into the structure of ORG . According to Section CARDINAL of the LAW the chambers of ORG could consider cases as , inter alia , the court of appeal instance .
The LAW was repealed on DATE .

CARDINAL . According to LAW the independence of judges was guaranteed by the manner of their appointment , termination and suspension of their office ; by the special procedure of awarding military ranks to the military judges ; by the special procedure of administration of justice ; by the secrecy of the decision - making process ; by prohibition of interference with the administration of justice ; by the establishment of the legal responsibility for contempt of court ; by the judges’ right to resign ; by the judges’ inviolability ; by the provision of the technical and informational conditions necessary for the operation of the courts ; by the material support and social welfare programs provided for the judges ; by the special procedure of the ORG financing ; and by the system of judicial self - government .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the LAW foresaw that judges of the military courts who needed to improve their living conditions were provided with an appropriate flat or house by ORG within the term of DATE from the date of their appointment .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Act provided that ORG were subordinate to ORG .
